questiontext.text:
A random sample of 98 observations was taken from a population with known standard deviation σ = 5.77.

The sample mean is 46.07.

Calculate a 90% confidence interval for the population mean.

Lower limit (3 decimal places): ___

Upper limit (3 decimal places): ___

In a random sample of 236 individuals, 186 had a particular characteristic.

This gives a sample proportion of 0.788.

Calculate a 90% confidence interval for the population proportion.

Lower limit (3 decimal places): ___

Upper limit (3 decimal places): ___

A random sample of 45 observations was taken from a population with known standard deviation σ = 6.13.

The sample mean is 48.8.

Calculate a 95% confidence interval for the population mean.

Lower limit (3 decimal places): ___

Upper limit (3 decimal places): ___

In a random sample of 389 individuals, 279 had a particular characteristic.

This gives a sample proportion of 0.717.

Calculate a 95% confidence interval for the population proportion.

Lower limit (3 decimal places): ___

Upper limit (3 decimal places): ___
